jmortgage.amortization
Class DefaultPmtKey

java.lang.Object
  jmortgage.amortization.DefaultPmtKey
All Implemented Interfaces:
PmtKey
public final class DefaultPmtKey
extends Object
implements PmtKey

The default implementation of PmtKey. This object calculates the Long value of a Date or Calendar object. The Long object acts as the key for Amortization schedule maps. DefaultPmtKey also encapsulates an Interval object which indicates the length of time between payment due dates. This object is immutable, so thread safety is guaranteed.

Since:
1.0
Author:
David Armstrong

Constructor Detail

DefaultPmtKey

public DefaultPmtKey(Interval interval)
Creates an object using the specified interval. The date defaults to midnight of the current date.

Parameters:
interval - The Interval object

DefaultPmtKey

public DefaultPmtKey(Interval interval,
                     Calendar cal)
Creates an object using the specified interval and Calendar object. The Long value of the key gets converted to midnight of the specified Calendar object.

Parameters:
interval - The Interval object
cal - The Calendar object

DefaultPmtKey

public DefaultPmtKey(Interval interval,
                     Date date)
Creates an object using the specified interval and Date object. The Long value of the key gets converted to midnight of the date specified in the Date object.

Parameters:
interval - The Interval object
date - The Date object to be converted to a Long

DefaultPmtKey

public DefaultPmtKey(Interval interval,
                     String dateStr,
                     String pattern)
              throws ParseException
Creates an object using the specified interval, date String and pattern String. The Long value of the key gets converted to midnight of the date value determined by the date String and pattern String. Uses SimpleDateFormat to parse the date String.

Parameters:
interval - The Interval object
dateStr - The String that represents a Date that is compatible with the pattern String
pattern - The pattern String
Throws:
ParseException
See Also:
SimpleDateFormat

DefaultPmtKey

Creates an object using the specified key. This constructor is protected and used only internally.

Parameters:
interval - The Interval object
key - The Long object
